docs.text: Getting started Brainy is a powerful learning app designed to make knowledge retention effortless and enjoyable. Whether you're a student, professional, or lifelong learner, Brainy empowers you to master any subject through active learning and scientifically-proven spaced repetition techniques. Key Features 📚 Notebook-Style Files — Seamlessly organize your notes and ideas in a centralized workspace 📁 Structured Organization — Manage and access study materials with intuitive folder hierarchies 🧠 Spaced Repetition — Retain knowledge effectively using the FSRS (Free Spaced Repetition Scheduler) algorithm with fully customizable parameters 🎯 Multiple Study Modes — Engage with flashcards, cloze deletions, true/false questions, and more ⚡ Keyboard Shortcuts — Navigate and work efficiently with comprehensive keyboard controls ☁️ Cloud Sync — Keep your data synchronized across all your devices in real-time 💾 Automatic Backups — Rest assured with periodic automatic backups of your data Quick Start Guide Getting started with Brainy is simple: 1. Create Your First File Open the app and locate the Sidebar on the left Click the three dots menu and select New File Give your file a descriptive name and press Enter 2. Add Study Cards Click on your new file to open the Editor Click Add Cell to create a new study block Select Flash Card as the cell type Enter your question and answer Click outside the cell to save it 3. Start Reviewing Click the Study button in the sidebar The Reviewer will open showing your cards For each card, try to recall the answer before revealing it Rate how difficult it was using the feedback buttons Brainy will automatically schedule the next review based on your performance Need Help? Report Issues or Request Features Found a bug or have a feature idea? Visit the GitHub Issues page to report it. Contact the Developer For questions or feedback, reach out to the developer at ramialkawadri@hotmail.com .

docs.text: Reviewer The reviewer allows you to review the repetitions for the cells and assists you with spaced repetition by applying the Free Spaced Repetition Scheduler . When reviewing a repetition, some information will be hidden to challenge your memory. Once you remember the answer or decide to give up, you can press the "Show Answer" button to reveal the correct answer. You will then see four buttons: Again , Hard , Good , and Easy . You should press the button that best represents how difficult it was for you to remember the answer. Above each button, you will see a time period indicating when the app will prompt you to review the repetition again when that button is pressed. In the reviewer, you will also find an edit button. Clicking it will take you to the cell in the editor so that you can edit the cell. Shortcuts Keyboard shortcut What it does Space Show answer 1 Again 2 Hard 3 Good 4 Easy E Edit

docs.text: Editor The Editor is where you create and modify your study content. Files are organized into study blocks called cells , each of which can be reviewed multiple times on a customizable schedule using spaced repetition. Cell Types Choose the study format that works best for you: Flash Card Traditional question-and-answer format (like Anki). Perfect for: - Vocabulary and language learning - Definitions and concepts - Questions with detailed answers Cloze Deletion Text with hidden sections that you must fill in from memory. Great for: - Language learning and grammar - Definition and context-based learning - Sentence completion exercises Note: Cloze cells can have multiple groups, each generating separate review repetitions. True/False Statements you evaluate as true or false. Ideal for: - Fact-checking exercises - Concept verification - Quick comprehension checks Note Non-reviewed text for organization and reference. Use for: - Titles and section headers - Supplementary information - Context and explanations Note: Notes appear in the editor but are skipped during review sessions. Cell Controls (Focus Tools) When you select a cell (highlighted by a colored border), focus tools appear: Tool Function Insert Add a new cell after the current one Reset Clear all review history for this cell and start fresh Info View detailed statistics about the cell's repetitions Delete Remove the cell and all its review data (requires confirmation) Drag Reorder cells by dragging them to new positions Rich Text Editing Cell content areas feature a powerful text editor with: - Text Formatting — Bold, italic, underline, and more - Image Insertion — Embed images directly into your cards - Formatting Menu — Select text to access formatting options via a floating menu Cloze-Specific Formatting When editing cloze cells, the formatting menu includes: - Add/Remove Cloze — Mark or unmark text as a cloze deletion - Group Number Controls — Increase or decrease the cloze group number for managing multiple deletion groups Keyboard Shortcuts Work faster in the editor with these shortcuts: Shortcut Action Ctrl + Enter Insert new cell at the end of the file Ctrl + Shift + Enter Insert new cell after the current selected cell Ctrl + Arrow up/down Move focus to the previous/next cell Ctrl + Alt + Arrow up/down Move the selected cell up/down Ctrl + F Search Ctrl + Space Move focus to the text editor Alt + DEL Delete current cell F5 Start studying/review session

docs.text: Reviewer The Reviewer is where you study your cards using scientifically-optimized spaced repetition powered by FSRS (Free Spaced Repetition Scheduler) . Review Process Study a Card A card appears with some information hidden to challenge your recall Try to remember the answer from memory Click Show Answer to reveal the correct answer If you give up, you can also click Show Answer at any time Rate Your Performance After revealing the answer, choose how difficult it was to remember: Rating Use When Again (1) You completely forgot or got it wrong Hard (2) You remembered but with significant effort Good (3) You remembered with reasonable ease Easy (4) You remembered instantly and effortlessly Next Review Time Each button shows when you'll see this card again: - Again — Usually within days (for cards you need more practice with) - Hard — Longer interval (you're getting there) - Good — Even longer interval (you've mostly mastered it) - Easy — Longest interval (you know this well) Editing During Review Click the Edit button to jump directly to the card's editor if you need to: - Correct an error - Update the card content - Add clarifications Your changes are saved immediately when you return to review. Keyboard Shortcuts Speed through your reviews with keyboard shortcuts: Shortcut Action Space Show answer 1 Again 2 Hard 3 Good 4 Easy E Edit

docs.text: Search & Find Quickly locate any content across your entire study library with Brainy's powerful search functionality. How to Search Click Search in the sidebar or press Ctrl + Shift + F Type your search query in the text field Press Enter to view all matching results Search Results Search results display all matching cells across your files. For each result: - Click to preview the cell content - Use the cell reference to jump directly to that card in the editor Tip: From any search result, you can instantly navigate to the original file and cell using the focus tools!

docs.text: Sidebar & Navigation The sidebar is your command center for navigating Brainy. It provides quick access to all major features and file management capabilities. Sidebar Components Navigation & Quick Actions Home — View your study overview and heatmap Search — Find cells across all your files Settings — Customize app preferences Sync — Manually synchronize your data across devices Help — Access documentation File Management Area The central section displays your complete file and folder structure, allowing you to organize and manage your study materials. FSRS Configuration Customize spaced repetition settings for individual files or folders to optimize your learning experience based on your preferences. Account Management Sign in, sign up, or manage your account settings from the sidebar. Collapsing the Sidebar Click the arrow next to the Brainy title to collapse and expand the sidebar and maximize your working space. File Management Brainy provides a comprehensive set of tools for organizing your study materials: Creating Files and Folders New Folder — Right-click on any folder and select New Folder to create a subfolder for organizing related content New File — Right-click on a folder and select New File to create a new study file Organizing Your Files Rename — Right-click a file or folder and select Rename to give it a more descriptive name Move — Drag and drop files or folders to reorganize them into different locations Delete — Right-click and select Delete to remove items (⚠️ Note: Deletions are permanent and cannot be undone) Sharing and Backup Export — Right-click a file or folder and select Export to save it to your disk for sharing with others Import — Import files you've exported or received from others Customizing FSRS (Spaced Repetition) Optimize your learning by customizing the FSRS (Free Spaced Repetition Scheduler) algorithm: Right-click on any file or folder and select FSRS Profile Adjust algorithm parameters to match your learning style and retention goals Settings can be applied to individual files or entire folders Changes take effect immediately for future reviews Keyboard Shortcuts Speed up your workflow with these essential keyboard shortcuts: Shortcut Action Ctrl + \ Collapse/Expand the sidebar Ctrl + N Create new file DEL Delete the selected file F2 Rename selected file Ctrl + P Open settings Ctrl + H Navigate to home Ctrl + Shift + H Navigate to search

docs.text: Automatic Backups Brainy automatically creates regular backups of your entire database to protect against data loss. How Backups Work Backup Location Backups are stored automatically in your settings directory Same location as your main brainy.db database file Backup Naming Each backup includes a timestamp (e.g., brainy.db.backup.2025-01-22-145030 ) Timestamps help you identify when each backup was created Multiple backups accumulate over time Restoring from a Backup If something goes wrong and you need to restore from a backup: Steps to Restore Close Brainy — Exit the application completely Navigate to Settings Directory — Locate your backups Find the folder containing your brainy.db file You'll see backup files named brainy.db.backup.* Select Your Backup — Choose which backup to restore from Pick the timestamp closest to when you last had good data Prepare for Restore Delete or rename the current brainy.db file (save it elsewhere as a safety measure) Rename your chosen backup file to brainy.db Restart Brainy — Open the application It will load data from the restored backup Example Original: brainy.db.backup.2025-01-20-100000 Restore: brainy.db Best Practices ✅ Enable auto-sync to keep cloud copies of your data ✅ Periodically backup your settings directory to external storage ✅ Note the timestamps of your most important backups ⚠️ Always keep the current brainy.db file as a safety measure before testing restores

docs.text: Cloud Sync Keep your study materials synchronized across all your devices seamlessly. How Cloud Sync Works Automatic Synchronization Changes you make on one device are automatically: 1. Uploaded to Brainy's servers 2. Downloaded to your other devices 3. Merged with your local data This ensures your study progress stays current across all devices. Getting Started with Sync Email Verification Before using sync: 1. Set up an account and log in 2. Verify your email address via the verification code that you can enter in the app 3. Sync functionality becomes available Enable Auto-Sync In Settings , enable these options for automatic synchronization: Sync on Startup and on close — Sync when you open the app and when you close the app. Sync Conflict Resolution Last-Write-Wins Strategy If you modify the same card on two devices before they sync: - The version with the most recent timestamp wins - Earlier changes are overwritten - Example: If you edit a card on your phone, then your laptop (without syncing first), the laptop's version becomes the official version Best Practice: Sync frequently to avoid accidental data loss. Storage Limits Maximum Storage 100 MB total storage for all synced items This includes all files, cards, and metadata Sufficient for most users with thousands of cards Keyboard Shortcuts Shortcut Action Ctrl + Shift + Y Sync

docs.text: Settings Customize Brainy to match your preferences and workflow: General Settings Database Location Specifies where your database file ( brainy.db ) is stored Contains all your files, cells, and study data Useful for backup or moving your data to a different location Changes take effect after restarting the app Theme Light — Bright interface for daytime use Dark — Dark interface for comfortable viewing in low light System — Automatically follows your operating system's theme preference Zoom Level Adjust the size of text and UI elements Useful if you prefer larger or more compact text Changes apply immediately Sync & Data Auto-Sync on Startup & Close Enabled — Your data automatically syncs when you open and close the app Disabled — Manual sync only (use Ctrl + Shift + Y to sync manually) Helpful for keeping your data current across devices See Cloud Sync for more information Account Management Sign Out Log out of your current account while keeping local data intact. Update Account Information Change your email address or password associated with your Brainy account. Delete Account ⚠️ Permanent action — Removes your account and all synced data from the server. Local data remains but sync functionality will be unavailable.
